item.title: World Business Class flights departing from Amsterdam on KLM will now offer meals created by renowned three-star chef Jacob Jan Boerma
item.description:
Source: KLM. Boerma. Beginning October 25, 2015, KLM Royal Dutch Airlines will feature meals from three-star Michelin chef Jacob Jan Boerma in their World Business Class on flights departing from Amsterdam*. As the first chef to partner with KLM for an entire year, Boerma brings a unique touch to their in-flight dining experience. Miriam Kartman, KLM’s Executive Vice President of Inflight Services, expressed their pride in collaborating with another Michelin-starred chef...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/world-business-class-flights-departing-from-amsterdam-on-klm-will-now-offer-meals-created-by-renowned-three-star-chef-jacob-jan-boerma/

item.title: Do Member States have the authority to make decisions that are above the law? Is it possible to challenge Member States' decisions regarding the locations of EU agencies?
item.description:
Ezio Perillo, formerly a judge on the EU General Court and the EU civil service tribunal, argues that decisions made by EU Member States regarding the locations of European agencies may not be subject to judicial review by the EU Court. This is based on the Sharpston-Council orders (cases C-684/20P and C-685/20P), which deemed the former British Advocate Generalâ€™s challenge against a new AG appointment inadmissible, and Advocate General Bobek’s opinion in joined cases concerning the European Medicines Agency (EMA) and the European Labour Authority (ELA) (cases C-59/18, C-182/18, and C-743/19, and in a parallel opinion in Cases C-106/19 and 232/19)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/do-member-states-have-the-authority-to-make-decisions-that-are-above-the-law-is-it-possible-to-challenge-member-states-decisions-regarding-the-locations-of-eu-agencies/

item.title: First in Windmills, First in WiMAX
item.description:
To understand the future of technology in the 21st century, one might look to the Netherlands. The Dutch have consistently been at the forefront of business and technology, and now they’re the first in Europe to launch mobile WiMAX as a wireless broadband standard. Mobile WiMAX, based on the IEEE 802.16e standard, expands on the fixed wireless 802.16d standard. It’s being promoted as a large-scale Wi-Fi solution or a remedy for 3G cellular backhaul issues...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/first-in-windmills-first-in-wimax/
